cards.name: Cursed Stone
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
At any time between turns, each player puts 1 damage counter on his or her Pokémon that has a Poké-Power.

ability.name: Dual Armor
ability.text: As long as Lanturn has any Water Energy attached to it, Lanturn is both Water and Lightning type.

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Lanturn but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more then 40 damage in this way.

cards.name: Fieldworker
text: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Draw 3 cards. Your opponent may also draw a card.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Remove all Special Conditions and 5 damage counters (all if there are less than 5) from Lairon. Lairon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Wobbuffet from your hand onto Wynaut (this counts as evolving Wynaut) and remove all damage counters from Wynaut.

attacks.name: Confusion Wave
attacks.text: Both Wynaut and the Defending Pokémon are now Confused.

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Rainbow Energy
text: Attach Rainbow Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Rainbow Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Has no effect other than providing Energy.) When you attach this card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon.

cards.name: React Energy
text: React Energy provides Colorless Energy.

ability.name: Sol Shade
ability.text: As long as you have Solrock in play, each player's Fire Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Moon Guidance
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card (excluding Supporter cards), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Psyshock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

ability.name: Rear Sensor
ability.text: Each player's Active Basic Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Foresight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order you like.

attacks.name: Disorder
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Influence
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Lileep, or Anorith and put up to 2 of them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

attacks.name: Stretch Claws
attacks.text: If Anorith has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Stages of Evolution
ability.text: As long as Wobbuffet is an Evolved Pokémon, your opponent pays Colorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Wobbuffet.

attacks.name: Shadow Tag
attacks.text: Put 7 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon at the end of your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Power Circulation
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your discard pile for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it on top of your deck. If you do, put 1 damage counter on Sealeo. This power can't be used if Sealeo is affected by a Special Condition.

cards.name: Claw Fossil
text: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Claw Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Claw Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Claw Fossil from play.
If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Fireworks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy attached to Torkoal.

attacks.name: Devolution Wave
attacks.text: Count the number of React Energy cards attached to Cradily and choose up to that number of your opponent's Evolved Pokémon. Remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of those Pokémon, then have your opponent shuffle those cards into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Support Navigation
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you put Lapras onto your Bench from your hand, you may search your deck for a Supporter card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

ability.name: Stench
ability.text: As long as Muk is your Active Pokémon, each player's Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Poison Ring
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Type Change
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Mew is the same type as that Pokémon (all if that Pokémon is more than 1 type) until the end of your turn. This power can't be used if Mew is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Mew and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 50.

ability.name: Reactive Generator
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Huntail has no React Energy cards attached to it, you may search your deck for a React Energy card and attach it to Huntail. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Huntail is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Bite Off
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Shining Horn
ability.text: As long as Pinsir is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Cry for Help
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex), show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Overhead Toss
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Luna Shade
ability.text: As long as you have Lunatone in play, each player's Colorless Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) can't use any Poké-Powers.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lunatone and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Hyper Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Ancient Protection
ability.text: Each of your Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, and Kabutops ex has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Granite Head
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Kabuto by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Time Spiral
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, remove the highest Stage Evolution card on that Pokémon and have your opponent shuffled it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Haunt
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Root Fossil
text: Play Root Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Root Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Root Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Root Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Root Fossil from play.
At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

cards.name: Power Tree
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Once during each player's turn, if the player has no Special Energy cards in his or her discard pile, that player searches his or her discard pile for a basic Energy card, shows it to the opponent, and puts it into his or her hand.

cards.name: Mysterious Fossil
text: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (as well as a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Mysterious Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play.

cards.name: Dustox ex

ability.name: Safeguard
ability.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Dustox ex by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Silver Wind
attacks.text: During your next turn, if an attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Regirock Star
text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Dig Drain
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Regirock Star.

attacks.name: Final Blast
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Regirock Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, this attack's base damage is 100 instead of 30.

cards.name: Giant Stump
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Each player can't have more than 3 Benched Pokémon. When Giant Stump comes into play, each player discards Benched Pokémon and any cards attached to them until he or she has 3 Benched Pokémon. (You discard your Pokémon first.)

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy card, if any, attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Swift Blow
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 20 damage for each React Energy card attached to Machamp.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Pattern Distraction
ability.text: As long as Spinda is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent's Basic Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. You can't use more than 1 Pattern Distraction Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Whimsy Draw
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Spinda does 10 damage to itself.

ability.name: Reactive Aroma
ability.text: As long as Roselia has any React Energy cards attached to it, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) that has any React Energy cards attached to it between turns. You can't use more than 1 Reactive Aroma Poké-Body each turn.

attacks.name: Flick Poison
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Full Flame
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.
Put 4 damage counters instead of 2 on each Burned Pokémon between turns. The Special Condition Burned can't be removed by evolving or devolving the Burned Pokémon.

cards.name: Flygon ex

ability.name: Emerge Charge
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Flygon ex from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your discard pile for up to 2 Energy cards and attach them to Flygon ex.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Reactive Blast
attacks.text: You may discard any number of React Energy cards attached to Flygon ex. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage for each React Energy card you discarded.

ability.name: Baby Evolution
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Magmar from your hand onto Magby (this counts as evolving Magby) and remove all damage counters from Magby.

attacks.name: Ignite
attacks.text: If Full Flame is in play, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Armaldo ex

ability.name: Dual Armor
ability.text: As long as Armaldo ex has any React Energy cards attached to it, Armaldo ex is both Grass and Fighting type.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Armaldo ex.

ability.name: Reactive Protection
ability.text: Any damage done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon is reduced by 10 for each React Energy card attached to Aerodactyl (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Power Blow
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Aerodactyl.

attacks.name: Speed Stroke
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects, including damage, done to Aerodactyl by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Heavy Blow
attacks.text: Does 70 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Aggron. If Aggron has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 70 damage instead.

attacks.name: Bound Crush
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 60 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) During your next turn, Aggron can't use Bound Crush.

ability.name: Shadow Curse
ability.text: If Gengar would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may put 3 damage counters on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Cursed Reaction
attacks.text: Put 2 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If Gengar has any React Energy cards attached to it, put 4 damage counters instead.

ability.name: Ancient Shell
ability.text: As long as you have Omanyte or Omastar in play, damage done to Kabutops by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Energy Stream
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Kabutops.

attacks.name: Extra Claws
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, this attack does 50 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Ancient Fang
ability.text: As long as you have Kabuto, Kabutops, or Kabutops ex in play, Omastar's attacks do 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

ability.name: Reactive Lift
ability.text: As long as Wailord has any React Energy cards attached to it, the Retreat Cost for each of your Water Pokémon (excluding Pokémon-ex) is 0.

attacks.name: Hypno Splash
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Rely on Friends
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each of your Benched Stage 1 Evolved Pokémon.

ability.name: Shining Horn
ability.text: As long as Absol is the only Pokémon you have in play, your opponent's Basic Pokémon can't attack.

attacks.name: Extra Call
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon-ex, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

ability.name: Reactive Booster
ability.text: Each React Energy card attached to all of your Huntail and Gorebyss provides 2 Energy of every type but has no effect other than providing Energy.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Gorebyss but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

ability.name: Stages of Evolution
ability.text: As long as Magmar is an Evolved Pokémon, all Energy attached to Magmar are Fire Energy instead of their usual types.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Burning Sensation
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

ability.name: Reactive Recharge
ability.text: If Magneton would be Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move any number of React Energy cards from Magneton to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Multiple Force
attacks.text: If Magneton has any React Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Magnemite and Magneton (both yours and your opponent's) in play.

ability.name: Reactive Colors
ability.text: If Kecleon has any React Energy cards attached to it, Kecleon is Grass, Fire, Water, Lightning, Psychic, and Fighting type.

attacks.name: Tongue Whip
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

ability.name: Deep Sleep
ability.text: As long as Misdreavus is your Active Pokémon, each player flips 2 coins for his or her Pokémon that is Asleep between turns. If either coin is tails, that Pokémon is still Asleep.

attacks.name: Return Trance
attacks.text: Return an Energy card attached to Misdreavus to your hand. The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Dream Eater
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is not Asleep, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Plunder
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Trainer cards attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Reactive Healing
ability.text: Whenever you attach a React Energy card from your hand to Tangela, remove all damage counters from Tangela.

attacks.name: Entangling Vines
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, that Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Gentle Wrap
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

ability.name: Reactive Shield
ability.text: As long as Tentacruel has any React Energy cards attached to it, prevent all effects, including damage, done to any of your Tentacruel in play by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fury Strikes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Self Charge
attacks.text: Attach a Metal Energy card from your hand to Aron.

attacks.name: Iron Defense
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Clamperl during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Selfdestruct
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Geodude does 50 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from Grimer and put it onto Grimer. (This counts as evolving Grimer.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Tender Tentacles
attacks.text: If Lileep has any React Energy cards attached to it, remove 2 damage counters from Lileep.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mach Punch
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Drawup Power
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Important Errands
attacks.text: Search your deck for a React Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Jump On
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Pebble Throw
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Double Pinchers
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Double Tackle
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Whirlpool
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.name: Poison Payback
ability.text: If Wurmple is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Wurmple is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: String Pull
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch.

cards.name: Strange Cave
text: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

Once during each player's turn, that player may put an Omanyte, Kabuto, Aerodactyl, Aerodactyl ex, Lileep, or Anorith onto his or her Bench from his or her hand. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

cards.name: Mew ex

ability.name: Versatile
ability.text: Mew ex can use the attacks of all Pokémon in play as its own. (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Power Move
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to Mew ex. Shuffle your deck afterward. Then, you may switch Mew ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

ability.name: Reactive Shift
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may move a React Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon. This power can't be used if Delcatty is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Energy Link
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for an Energy card and attach it to Delcatty.

attacks.name: Mend
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for a Fighting Energy card and attach it to Golem. If you do, remove 2 damage counters from Golem.

attacks.name: Enraged Linear Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each damage counter on Golem to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rock Tumble
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

ability.name: Evolutionary Fan
ability.text: Once during your turn, when you play Shiftry from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may choose 1 of your Evolved Pokémon in play (excluding any Shiftry). Return that Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

attacks.text: If Shiftry has any React Energy cards attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Cross-Cut
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

ability.name: Nectar Pod

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sharp Leaf
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage.

If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from Cascoon and put it onto Cascoon. (This counts as evolving Cascoon.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Cascoon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused. You may switch Dunsparce with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Sleep Seed

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

ability.text: Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by your Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, or Kabutops ex isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.text: Damage done to your opponent's Pokémon by your Omanyte, Omastar, Kabuto, Kabutops, or Kabutops ex isn't affected by Resistance.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Banette ex

ability.name: Shady Move
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Banette ex is your Active Pokémon, you may move 1 damage counter from either player's Pokémon to another Pokémon (yours or your opponent's). This power can't be used if Banette ex is affected by a Special Condition.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Shadow Chant
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Supporter card in your discard pile. You can't add more than 60 damage in this way.

cards.name: Walrein ex

ability.name: Icy Aura
ability.text: As long as Walrein ex is your Active Pokémon, put 1 damage count on each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) between turns, excluding Water Pokémon.

text: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Water Arrow
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Regice Star
text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Ice Barrier
attacks.text: Prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Regice Star by your opponent's Pokémon-ex during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Final Blizzard
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Regice Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, this attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Registeel Star
text: You can't have more than 1 Pokémon Star in your deck.

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to Registeel Star by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Final Laser
attacks.text: Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like. If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left and Registeel Star is the only Pokémon you have in play, put 6 damage counters instead.

attacks.name: Thunder Wave
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Iron Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.
